place.name: LLANEDERN
place.gazetteerText: LLANEDARN, a parish in Cardiff district, Glamorgan; on the river Rumney, at the boundary with Monmouth, and near the South Wales railway, 5 miles NE by N of Cardiff. Post town, Cardiff. Acres, 2,636. Real property, £2,121. Pop. in 1851,338; in 1861,289. Houses, 63. The property is divided among a few. Cevn-Mably and Ruperra are chief residences. The living is a vicarage, annexed to the vicarage of St. Mellons, in the diocese of Llandaff. The church is dedicated to St. Edlyrn, and was reported in 1859 as not good. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
